pageTitle: Itinerary for Sunday, November 11, 2018 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Paris, France

11:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will attend the 1918 Armistice Centennial Commemorative Ceremony.

Arc de Triomphe
Place Charles de Gaulle

Note for media:

    • Pooled coverage

1:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend a leader’s luncheon hosted by President of the French Republic Emmanuel Macron.

Closed to media.

3:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend the Paris Peace Forum Opening Plenary.

Closed to media

4:45 p.m. The Prime Minister will participate in the Reporters without Borders Declaration, and will deliver remarks. President of the French Republic Emmanuel Macron, Chancellor of the Federal Republic of Germany Angela Merkel, President of the Republic of Tunisia Beji Caid Essebsi, President of the Republic of Costa Rica Carlos Alvarado Quesada, President of the Republic of Senegal Macky Sall, and Prime Minister of Norway Erna Solberg will also participate in the Declaration.

Salle de Presse, Level One
Grande Halle de La Villette
211 Avenue Jean Jaurès

Note for media:

    • Pooled coverage

5:35 p.m. The Prime Minister will present J'ai serré la main du diable: La faillite de l'humanité au Rwanda by Lieutenant-General Roméo Dallaire and Paris 1919: Six Months that Changed the World by Margaret MacMillan to the Peace Library.

Bibliothèque de la Paix
Grande Halle de La Villette
211 Avenue Jean Jaurès

Note for media:

    • Pooled coverage
